questions.query: How is the project CollabTech?
questions.explanation: Collabberry is designed to be the Compensation tool for Collaboration. With the concept of Team Points and the decentralized method of measuring value, it aligns incentives and embraces co-ownership in the team that's using it.

questions.query: Who's the targeted user group and what's the need/problem being addressed?
questions.explanation:
The target group are early stage teams. The problem statement is: 

I am a founder of an initiative/company/campaign
I am trying to form a strong team to build our project
But I can’t reward the contributors fairly
Because I can’t measure the value created
Which makes me feel blocked.

questions.query: How do you ensure value keeps being delivered after the round is over? (How will the project become commercially sustainable or a perennial good? )
questions.explanation:
Collabberry is a venture within RnDAO, and we're dedicated to delivering a solution for our target group. Using Collabberry's compensation model within our team, we ensure to maximize our runway. The project is already funded by a Questbook grant, on a milestone basis and we're already delivering on those. 

After MVP is built, the project relies on Transaction Fees to ensure that the team can be self-sustaining and keep on building.

questions.query: How long will it take after funding is received to deliver value? (share a high level timeline)
questions.explanation:
Q1 2024 - Research within RnDAO's fellowship program
Q2 2024 - Planning, Initiation, Beginning to Prototype
Q3 2024 - Prototyping and Building (wireframes, user tests)
Q4 2024 - MVP building and beta release

data.text: After the research, Collabbery has entered as the RnDAO venture providing dynamic sweat ownership for DAO contributors.
data.title: Collabberry is in RnDAO

questions.query: Describe your previous work or plans related to the Arbitrum ecosystem. How does your project strengthen Arbitrum's foundational infrastructure, improve developer efficiency, or accelerate the adoption of novel applications?
questions.explanation:
Collabberry is the Compensation tool for Collaboration and it's being built in the Arbitrum ecosystem. 
Having such tool in the ecosystem will enable more projects to be formed and built, as well as more DAOs being initiated in Arbitrum.

questions.query: Describe your team's expertise in your chosen focus area within the Arbitrum ecosystem. Include relevant experience, publications, or past projects.

The paper can be found here: 
https://www.rndao.io/blog/post/compensation-in-early-stage-teams

questions.explanation: We participated in the ColabTech community round by RnDAO

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation:
We're an open source project, promoting modularity and composability through enabling people to contribute to our project, integrate, and build on top. 
Our tool serves as a compensation model for early-stage teams, so it empowers other OSS projects that lack funding to build more sustainably.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation: Collabberry is a tool for Compensation of early-stage teams. It introduces on-chain points representing sweat equity and also introduces features for measuring value using p2p assessment based on culture and work contributions.

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: We are 4 contributors at the moment, 2 of them paid in FIAT, the grant funds will allow us to extend our runway and give us more time to build the MVP of the project.

questions.query: How does your project contribute to the growth of the OSS ecosystem? Please provide specific examples of how your application enhances or expands the current ecosystem.
questions.explanation: Collabberry is an open source tool, aiming to solve compensation in early stage teams, including other open source projects. With our decentralized ownership setup, we enable teams to build agreements about contributions and compensations while accounting for their provided value through our peer-to-peer assessment protocol. This way we make it easy for projects to bootstrap with little or no funding.

questions.query: What features or use cases does your dApp/App present? How is it differentiated?
questions.explanation:
Setup a new project from scratch 
Define and sign agreements with the contributors in the team 
Run monthly peer-to-peer assessment rounds to evaluate the value brought in the team 
Compensation package with a mix of onchain tokenized sweat equity and monetary compensation

questions.query: What are your plans for further development, and how will the grant funds be used to achieve these goals?
questions.explanation: The next step in our product evolution is developing an AI-powered Agreements Agent—a module that helps contributors and organizations define clear, fair agreements from the outset. This feature expands our existing tool and addresses a major friction point in early-stage collaboration. This grant will help us fund the development of the module.

data.text:
After the third month of the year of deploying Collabberry on Arbitrum (https://beta.collabberry.xyz/)

Our beta Product, designed with intuitive workflows in mind has successfully onboarded 32 organizations with their over a 100 of users/contributors. They are not a lot, but they are leveraging CollabBerry to formalize person-to-organization agreements with a correspondent USD value in retribution for people's performance: 
- People commit to their roles & responsibilities,
- Organizations commit to compensating them—not just in money but also in ownership shares.

Through peer-to-peer assessment, contributors evaluate each other’s impact, creating a performance-based attributed value system that blends qualitative and quantitative metrics. This data-driven accountability layer ensures that compensation—both monetary and equity-based—is aligned with real contributions.

In this context, and in just a couple of months, **CollabBerry has accounted for 300k USD **(aprox) in attributed value, reflecting the actual economic impact of work rather than just fixed costs or wages.

As we evolve, our goal is to bridge this attributed value with market mechanisms, enabling fairer pricing, profit-sharing, and financial recognition based on real performance data. By making contribution-based value visible and tradable, we are setting the foundations for a more transparent and equitable economic model—one where work isn’t just paid for, but owned.

We hope we'll get to 1.000.000 USD in the next few months with awareness that such number is just a promise, and the organizations building their equity within our platform must deliver value that overcome such sweat generated debt. 

This is just a start to explore how novel web3 Collaboration Coordination Mechanisms can boost up in our will to create a Post-Capitalist world.
data.title: Impact in Early Stage value generation
